meanings.definition: A type of flowering plant with long hanging clusters of purple or white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The wisterias in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: I love the sweet fragrance of wisterias in full bloom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to swing from the wisterias like a vine.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cascaded through the room like wisterias in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The wisterias swayed gently in the breeze, a purple curtain in the garden.

meanings.definition: The flowers of the wisteria plant.
meanings.sent1: The delicate petals of the wisterias danced in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She picked a bouquet of wisterias to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the wisterias were tiny purple umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed as beautifully as the wisterias in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The wisterias added a touch of elegance to the outdoor wedding ceremony.

meanings.definition: The vine or shrub that produces wisteria flowers.
meanings.sent1: The wisterias climbed up the trellis, reaching for the sun.
meanings.sent2: The old oak tree was adorned with cascades of wisterias.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the wisterias were perfect for hiding.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed smoothly, intertwined like wisterias on a fence.
meanings.sent5: The wisterias framed the entrance, welcoming visitors with their beauty.
